subject: Philosophy
title: Materialism vs. Idealism
description: A quick win: understand Materialism vs. Idealism.

hook.text: Is the universe made of matter, or is matter made of mind? Your answer shapes everything.

buildup.text: Materialists say only physical stuff is real. Thoughts are just neurons firing in your brain.

discovery.text: Idealists say the opposite. Berkeley argued objects only exist when perceived.

twist.text: Samuel Johnson kicked a stone and said 'I refute it thus.' But that missed Berkeley's point.

climax.text: Modern physics leans materialist, but consciousness remains stubbornly hard to explain.

punchline.text: Mind from matter, or matter from mind?

quiz.question: What did George Berkeley argue about physical objects?
